item.title: Social Security’s new commissioner, rule reversals and cost cuts: Here’s everything that’s happening at the agency
item.description: A Social Security “war room,” threats to shut the agency, worker buyouts and a restraining order — here’s a timeline of what has taken place so far th...

item.title: Supreme Court grants DOGE access to Social Security data, days after Musk stepped down
item.description: The decision is the latest development in a battle over the Department of Government Efficiency’s access to sensitive personal information.

item.title: Tony Awards: Here’s how one woman saw every Broadway show this season — for less than $50 a ticket on average
item.description: Liz Davenport used every trick in the discount playbook, including serving as a volunteer usher.

item.title: My father-in-law has dementia and is moving in with us. Can we invoice him for a caregiver?
item.description: “Do we have an obligation to provide my wife’s troubled sibling with an accounting of my father-in-law’s expenses?”

item.title: I help my elderly mother every day and drive her to appointments. Can I recoup my costs from her estate?
item.description: “I don’t want to upset her while she’s living. Stress makes her condition worse.”
